items.title: What happened after Tesla opened a diner in Los Angeles?
items.content_html:
The novelty of eating at a diner owned by the richest person in the world seems to have worn off in just a few months

Less than six months since it opened, Elon Musk‚Äôs Tesla Diner has the feel of a ghost town. Gone is the Optimus robot serving popcorn, gone are the carnivore-diet-inspired ‚ÄúEpic Bacon‚Äù strips, gone are the hours-long, hundred-person lines wrapped around the block. Even the restaurant‚Äôs all-star chef, Eric Greenspan, is gone. The Hollywood burger-and-fries shop seems like a shell of the bustling eatery it was when it opened in late July.

On a balmy Friday afternoon in December, the parking lot for Tesla car charging was, at best, half full. Inside what the company describes as a ‚Äúretro-futuristic‚Äù diner, a handful of people trickled in, ordering burgers and hotdogs or asking for merch. The upstairs deck, AKA ‚ÄúSkypad‚Äù, was vacant except for a pair of employees stringing holiday lights. More staff was busy at work, buffing fingerprints off the chrome walls and taking out the trash, than there were customers. The diner was spotless.

items.title: Venezuela attack: what we know so far as US captures President Maduro
items.content_html:
US president confirms attack on Venezuela and says Nicol√°s Maduro and wife Cilia Flores have been flown out of country

‚Ä¢‚Äã US strikes on Venezuela ‚Äì live updates

The US president, Donald Trump, has said Venezuela‚Äôs dictator, Nicol√°s Maduro, and his wife, Cilia Flores, have been captured and flown out of the country after a ‚Äúlarge scale‚Äù pre-dawn assault on Caracas and the surrounding region. Here is what we know so far:

US attorney general Pam Bondi says deposed Venezuelan leader Nicol√°s Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, will face criminal charges after an indictment in New York. Bondi vowed in a social media post that the couple will ‚Äúsoon face the full wrath of American justice on American soil in American courts‚Äù.

In a statement on X, US secretary of state Marco Rubio said Maduro is ‚Äúunder indictment for pushing drugs in the United States‚Äù. Republican US Senator Mike Lee said on Saturday that Rubio had told him that he ‚Äúanticipates no further action in Venezuela now that Maduro is in US custody‚Äù.

Earlier, Donald Trump posted on his Truth Social platform that the US had ‚Äúcaptured‚Äù Venezuela‚Äôs dictator, Maduro, and his wife, and flown them out of the South American country after a pre-dawn assault on Caracas and the surrounding region.

Venezuela‚Äôs government accused the US of launching a series of attacks against civilian and military targets in the South American country, after explosions rocked its capital, Caracas, before dawn on Saturday.

In a statement, Venezuela‚Äôs government urged citizens to rise up against the assault and said Washington risked plunging Latin America into chaos with ‚Äúan extremely serious‚Äù act of ‚Äúmilitary aggression‚Äù. It added: ‚ÄúThe entire country must mobilise to defeat this imperialist aggression.‚Äù

items.title: Cremation pyre in Africa thought to be world‚Äôs oldest containing adult remains
items.content_html:
9,500-year-old pyre uncovered in Malawi offers rare insight into rituals of ancient African hunter-gatherer groups

A cremation pyre built about 9,500 years ago has been discovered in Africa, offering a fresh glimpse into the complexity of ancient hunter-gatherer communities.

Researchers say the pyre, discovered in a rock shelter at the foot of Mount Hora in northern Malawi, is thought to be the oldest in the world to contain adult remains, the oldest confirmed intentional cremation in Africa, and the first pyre to be associated with African hunter-gatherers.

items.title: Tensions between Saudis and Emiratis over future of Yemen reach boiling point
items.content_html:
Dispute has potential to create civil war in south of Yemen and spill over into neighbouring countries

Tensions between the United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia over the future of Yemen and the imminent possibility of the declaration of an independent southern state have reached boiling point with Saudi Arabia in effect accusing the UAE of threatening its future security.

The dispute has the potential to create a civil war within the south of Yemen and also spill over into other disputes including in Sudan and the Horn of Africa where the two countries often find themselves backing opposite sides. Yemen could yet become only one theatre in which the two vastly wealthy Gulf states vie for political influence, control of shipping lanes and commercial access.

items.content_html: RB Leipzig's appointment of Tatjana Haenni makes her the first woman to hold the post of CEO at a Bundesliga club.

items.title: New strain of mpox virus: What you need to know
items.content_html: A hybrid form of mpox has been identified in the UK. Health professionals are not surprised that the sexually transmitted virus has evolved but say it's a reminder of the need for precaution.

items.title: Poland: A trillion‚Äëdollar player knocking on the G20's door
items.content_html: Poland has been invited to observe the G20 summit in Miami next year. Full membership in the elite club may still be years away, but could it finally put Central Europe on the global map?

items.title: UN environment head warns of climate complacency
items.content_html: Trillions of dollars could be gained every year and millions of lives saved from protecting the climate and environment, according to the UN. DW speaks to Inger Andersen about what might help us get there.

items.title: Why Japan's economic woes spark global market concern
items.content_html: Japan's PM Sanae Takaichi wants to spend big to boost sluggish growth, despite the country's already huge debt load. With bond yields already rising, a sudden spike could shock the financial world well beyond Japan.

items.title: Tropical cyclones: Why are some countries more at risk?
items.content_html: When tropical storms make headlines, certain countries and regions are repeatedly part of the story. Why is that and what fuels cyclones and their paths?

items.title: Sports clubs in Germany: Unique thanks to their coaches
items.content_html: The culture of German sports clubs is like no other. Thanks to volunteer work, you can participate in and train for almost any sport at a low cost. Enthusiastic coaches are crucial to this.

items.title: New AI model can predict 5-year breast cancer risk
items.content_html: A new AI model can predict a person's risk of developing breast cancer up to five years in advance by analyzing mammograms. This could make screening much more effective.

items.title: New discovery: The 'sacred boundary' surrounding Stonehenge
items.content_html: Long thought to be an assortment of mysterious holes near Stonehenge, researchers have now used new technologies to better understand the culture that dug a circle of ditches around the monument in southern England.
